p: The rare occurrence of infectious diseases in wild plants serves as a fundamental indication of the presence of competent defence mechanisms. Different mechanisms of action through which phytochemicals can exert antimicrobial activities include (i) inhibition of the activity of enzymes and toxins, (ii) damage of the bacterial membrane, (iii) suppression of virulence factors, (iv) formation of biofilm, (v) inhibition of protein synthesis, and (vi) quorum quenching [ 96]. The mode of action of tannins is based majorly on their ability to bind proteins, thereby inhibiting cell protein synthesis [ 97â€“ 99]. The intervention of quorum sensing is in three levels: (i) signal synthesis, (ii) signal sequestration, and (iii) signal reception [ 100].
